glsa.title: Cacti: SQL injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: With special configurations of Cacti it is possible to change passwords via a SQL injection attack.

background.p: Cacti is a complete web-based front end to rrdtool.

description.p: Cacti is vulnerable to a SQL injection attack where an attacker may inject SQL into the Username field.

impact.p: An attacker could compromise the Cacti service and potentially execute programs with the permissions of the user running Cacti. Only systems with php_flag magic_quotes_gpc set to Off are vulnerable. By default, Gentoo Linux installs PHP with this option set to On.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version of Cacti.
